website_summaries.verdict: A great microphone if you're looking for something that will work with both smartphones and DSLR cameras, among other devices.
pros: Great sound quality when using at a short range
Includes a shock mount, 3.5 millimeter TRS cable for DSLR cameras, camcorders, and recorders, and a 3.5 millimeter TRRS cable for smartphones and tablets
cons: The shock mount is made of plastic and can break

customer_reviews.title: Plastic legs are flimsy
customer_reviews.text: So similar to a few other reviews here, I found out the hard way the little red plastic legs can snap easily. This happened in the first 5 minutes of unboxing, and unfortunately I won't be able to use this mic on my trip I'm leaving for tomorrow. Hoping I can get a replacement attachment when I return in a couple weeks.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Really nice sound.
customer_reviews.text: This provides really nice sound, when kept within 18 inches of the talent. Like virtually all mics, when you mount it on a camera four feet or more from the talent, you will not get very good sound. But that's just the way of mics. Caleb Pike reviewed this and stated that it has a noticeably hotter signal than the Rode Videomicro. I am pretty picky with audio, and I often will EQ to get things the way I like with various mics, but this one gives me quite good audio without EQ-ing. For being small and cheap, it has surprisingly good bass. And the upper end is crispy without being shrill. For the money, this is very nice.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis

customer_reviews.title: Decent Audio. Horrible Mount. Instant Return.
customer_reviews.text: The mic is good for Canon as the audio output is at a slightly higher DB, compared to Rode. However the included mount is trash and immediately broke. If you're going to buy this, budget for a better mount like  (untested fitting).
customer_reviews.author: MrDevanWright

customer_reviews.title: ... of the audio recordings with this mic are very good for it's type (short range
customer_reviews.text: Very good audio recordings for it's type (short range, shotgun for smartphone and dslr cameras to do "run and gun" style video where higher pro audio quality is not needed). The gain is strong. Metal build is good. Compares well with Rode small video mics and Boya M1 lapel. One star taken off for the poor "shock" mount. It snapped when I checked flex with my finger (see photo) because it is stiff, cheap plastic. Looks like a shock, but almost no flex. So far, not able to find replacement. Maker should change to compare with Rycote shock mount used by Rode. I would recommend for value even with poor shock.
customer_reviews.author: M. Akins

customer_reviews.title: Works good but giving it a 4 becasue it's really a ...
customer_reviews.text: Works good but giving it a 4 becasue it's really a rebranded BOYA which is 10 dollars cheaper most places. However it worked just fine on my iPhone SE, Nikon D5300 and Sony AX53. Loader and deeper sounding than my Rode Videomicro. I might like the Rode better in terms of sound but that preference is very slight. Also the cable on the Rode is better as both ends are angled. This makes a difference in mounting. That said the Movo/BOYA includes a cellphone cable which the Rode didn't. The dead cat is also just as effective as the Rode. The below photo has the Movo/BOYA mounted on an AS20 action cam. The Rode is mounted on my AX53.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin R

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy it if you have a Sony camera
customer_reviews.text: It brings A LOT of noise when plug in on the sony a6300 and sony a58. I researched a little bit and I found out I wasn't the only one. I couldn't figure out how to use it on a tascam recorder. BUT, I tried on an iPhone 5s and the sound was surprisingly good. No background noise, nice audio quality. I hope it's just me not knowing how to use it.
customer_reviews.author: Rodrigo Macías

customer_reviews.title: Looks great!  But changes it's reception on its own...
customer_reviews.text: This microphone looks professional grade, but it's sound quality is so-so and it automatically changes its reception, making videos sound faint at sporadic times. Not worth saving a few bucks to buy this cheaper model in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen

customer_reviews.title: Sound is OK if it isnt full of static, but almost always is
customer_reviews.text: Item is completely unusable, bought it as a gift for my cousin in advanced for his birthday, return window is now closed. I guess you get what you pay for. Audio recorded through an a6300 is riddled with extremely loud static noise even when the microphone is sitting complete still on a tripod mounted camera with no wind (indoors even), started with the stock auxiliary cord provided, tried a different one as well and had the same issue. I will be switching to the Rode microphone from now on
customer_reviews.author: A. Z. T.

customer_reviews.title: Nice and stable!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this instead of the Rode for pricing. The initial one I bought had a bent cable. The replacement has been good. The wind cover is good too. It fits pretty sturdy I have no complaints. The sound is good. The nice thing is no batteries required. I would buy it again and recommend.
customer_reviews.author: NEWmade

customer_reviews.title: Great customer service
customer_reviews.text: Great customer service, I broke the shock mount first time using it, they sent another with no issues. The shock mount does feel overly tight when clamping the mic in. For me I take it apart after every use because I'm doing location work and transporting equipment. Mic works great. The coiled cords would be nice to have 90 degree adapters on both ends, but that's minor. IMO cords could also be shorter, but no big deal. Also a nice feature of a competitor is having the built in clips to hold the the wire on the tightening nut for the shoe mount. Great price, great performance. I would buy again and again.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Henry

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work on GoPro Hero 7 Black
customer_reviews.text: This Movo VXR10 Universal Video Microphone did not work on my GoPro Hero 7 Black. Yes, I have the GoPro external mic adapter and also have both TRS and TRRS adapters, but this mic was just not picking up audio like an external mic should. There was no difference in sound with this Movo Mic and the internal mic of the GoPro itself. Since it sounds exactly the same, I sent it back for a refund. I'm so bummed it didn't work.
customer_reviews.author: Kailey

customer_reviews.title: GOOD SOUND AT A BARGAIN PRICE
customer_reviews.text: Other than having to get the 2.5 adaptor so that I can use it on my Fujifilm xt20, this microphone performs just as good as my RODE, which I use on my Canon. Great bargain for a microphone that give you this kind of excellent sound. I recommend it highly for run and gun videography and also for vloggers.
customer_reviews.author: Bestbeast333Top Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Please read this 1 star review and save yourself some time and hassle.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this to improve audio for a YouTube channel I'm working on. After reading other reviews I figured I'd give it a shot. The mount breaks ridiculously easily. Despite my best efforts 3 of the 4 mounts broke immediately. Then the mic didn't even work. We tried both cords and no luck. Started the return process tonight. Save your money and buy a better mic.
customer_reviews.author: Chuck

customer_reviews.title: Best no battery shotgun mic for Canon
customer_reviews.text: This is a lot more sensible than the Rode Video Micro, so for those who own Canon cameras, with awful preamps, it's a better option. 1 star off because the shock absorber isn't as flexible as it should, and the TRS cable included, can't be turned around because it won't stay in place (straight part has to be connected to the mic and angled to camera, if you connect it the other way, the straight part gets disconnected from camera). TRRS is not coiled also. It's awesome that includes all the the accessories.
customer_reviews.author: DCifuentesJ

customer_reviews.title: Easily breakable holder cheapens this product right out of the box.
customer_reviews.text: Was really excited to possibly buy these for our fleet of cameras but after taking out of the box and attempting to attach the mic to the holder the cheap plastic snapped. Really flimsy material.
customer_reviews.author: TheDuckyKing

customer_reviews.title: Microphone works great for teacher videos
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this to record instructional videos for my elementary art class. The recordings I was doing before with my phone’s internal mic were capturing a lot of distracting echo. I have never used an external mic before so hoped it would be straightforward on how to use. I was relieved when it came in that it had an instruction manual which was very clear. It also had a QR code which brings you to a pretty extensive unboxing, and set up instructions for various scenarios (ie vlogging, instructional, etc).
customer_reviews.author: Elecia B.

customer_reviews.title: Good little mic
customer_reviews.text: Only had if for a couple days as of this writing, but it does a decent job of being a mic. At this point I've only used if for inside video work and don't used the dead kitten cover for that. The mic and cables appear to be very good quality, well produced, the shoe mount/shock fits very tightly to the mic, and is rather rigid plastic. Not sure how much it will isolate the mic from camera body noise and such. The shoe attachment point fit perfectly, and is easy on/off as needed. At this point is appears to be a good purchase of a simple external camera mic.
customer_reviews.author: John D

customer_reviews.title: Tin can sound
customer_reviews.text: You can hears tiny artifacts in the audio especially when recording at an event in a sizable room. Did not have this experience with mics that were supposed to be of lesser quality. Also something seems to be loose inside the mic when you tap the housing with your fingers. Audio levels are much higher than the mic I was intending to replace with this one. Going to have to return it unfortunately. One star, definitely not worth the $40 bucks I paid for it.
customer_reviews.author: JB

customer_reviews.title: Static
customer_reviews.text: We bought this to use with live streaming of church events using an iPhone. I felt it was a good value based on the price, however after using it didn't make a significant improvement to the sound, and has consistently had a static feedback in the playback. Due to the static issue, I would not recommend this item.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Big difference from phone mic!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to shoot short interviews with my cell phone. Really improves audio quality and helps reduce ambient noise. I'm standing pretty close to my subjects (maybe 3ft) so not sure how well it would work further back. Does not attach directly to phone, I use a phone grip handle holder that has a mount which the mic attaches to. Red part that holds mic seems a little fragile but no issues so far. One other note. This did not work with the regular camera app on my phone (Moto g5). I did a quick search and ended up using Open Camera, free from the Google Play store. Went into audio settings and switched to use external microphone.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Berman

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Well for paying the extra money to get it next day my package arrived with the box open and that makes me feel like I’m getting an open box refurbish Itiem but it still works and love this mic . For the price and all the review I seen in glad I didn’t go with rose as I am a beginner with dslr camera . Looks good on my canon eos m50 .
customer_reviews.author: Hilo1

customer_reviews.title: It glitches when I record audio
customer_reviews.text: I bought this after watching a review video on YouTube and here but for some reason it definitely doesn’t cancel background noise, not even noise but something even as slight as air conditioning running. It also glitches a lot when I am recording and I don’t know till I go back and play it and it’s too late to do anything. It will skip over a bunch of words at once, I think it must be defective. Should’ve just bought the rode bc now I’ll be spending double the money, To see videos I’ve used it in, check out my YouTube channel, - Lanchen. My most recent art videos I’m using it
customer_reviews.author: Lanchen Designs

customer_reviews.title: I had high hopes... but...
customer_reviews.text: I got the mic based on YT reviews. When I received it I plugged the cable into the mic and noticed right away that the plus was sitting askew. I thought for a second that maybe it was designed that way, although I couldn't think of a good reason why it would be. I put the mic clip on my hot shoe, and then noticed that the red damper was snapped. Tough it could've been a shipping issue, it could also be an indication of reliability and ruggedness (or lack thereof). I have a replacement coming. I may have better luck with the replacement.
customer_reviews.author: John37

customer_reviews.title: Excellent value
customer_reviews.text: Just received this last night and ran it through its paces. I'm connecting this to a Nikon D7500 DSLR in order to record general audio, mostly speech. I was surprised at the clarity and the output level. I think it will perform well for my purposes - recording myself or others in a vidcast. Really good value for the money IMHO. One small niggle is the knob that clamps down the cold shoe on the shock mount seems a little flimsy. We'll have to see how it lasts over time. Other than that, its great!
customer_reviews.author: David W. RanckTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: and amazing tools I have ever purchased to upgrade the quality ...
customer_reviews.text: As a broke college student who is passionate in videography, this has to be one of the the most reliable, inexpensive, and amazing tools I have ever purchased to upgrade the quality of my videos. It is very user friendly (need I say more, lol) but the only thing is you have to tweak your settings if you have a Canon DSLR and have to be careful with the plastic mount because it is very fragile. But honestly, its worth the price and you are getting more than what you are paying for.
customer_reviews.author: Renee Barker

customer_reviews.title: Perfect first mic for your “big” camera
customer_reviews.text: This mic hits way above its class. It sounds surprisingly good. It’s not a perfect microphone, but there’s nothing that’s measurably better without paying 5x as much. And for the size, accessories, build quality, and thoughtful engineering it’s an excellent purchase. Even for still photographers that occasionally shoot video, it’s worth it. I shoot stills 90% of the time. Whenever I’m going out and not using a flash trigger in the hot shoe, I’ll put this mic in there for the occasional video and it’s perfect. It makes those clips from your “big” camera sound as good as the video quality looks.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan F.

customer_reviews.title: Worked well for awhile.....
customer_reviews.text: It worked great for awhile but now a few months later, it’s very unreliable. My teen son’s use it the most and while they aren’t super easy on the go-Pro, they are fairly careful. Sometimes it does not record any sound, sometimes the sound is very bad and sometimes it works. At first we thought maybe the patch cord was bad, but after replacing that, it’s not the case. While not terribly expensive, it is always a little disappointing when things don’t work after a short period of time. The next microphone will have to be a little more of an investment.
customer_reviews.author: Pearl U

customer_reviews.title: For the money, it's hard to beat
customer_reviews.text: Sound quality is on par with, or maybe even a little better than, the more expensive Rode Videomicro. Don't expect pro sound, and do a little in post, and for 40 bucks, you can't go wrong. One issue I had was with the mount. It broke when trying to install the mic. Movo was kind enough to send a replacement right out to me and offered some advice. When installing the mic into the mount, apply pressure to the round part of the mount, no to the bottom of the base. This should prevent it from breaking.
customer_reviews.author: harry young

customer_reviews.title: Snap! No matter how careful you are
customer_reviews.text: I read several reviews about this mic before I purchased it. Most of the less favorable reviews warned of the shock mount Being Of very poor quality. I purchased it anyway as I knew To be extremely careful while mounting the mic in the shockmount. Within seconds... Snap! The shockmount broke. I returned it and soent a few extra bucks on a similar item Made by Shure. The shockmount is superior! This mic has a heavier bass sound compared to the Shure mic, which is more flat. I personally prefer a flat sound as my application for the mic yields better results bringing in flat audio compare to running filters to balance out the bottom end In post productions.
customer_reviews.author: NAT TURNER

customer_reviews.title: Reasonable for the money
customer_reviews.text: I have seen some people that had issues with the quality of the red colored mount, so I have been sure to not abuse it and it has held up fine to this point. The sound indoors is clear and I tested it against an oscillating fan and could get up to 6 inches away from the fan before the noise interrupted my voice. However, this thing does pick up EVERYTHING!!! From two rooms away I can clearly hear the fan running and when my A/C kicks on (I can barely hear it), but it sounds like a hurricane coming through on my mic. If the surrounding is quiet though, my voice is very clear.
customer_reviews.author: RTT: Guns & Gear

customer_reviews.title: NOT SO HAPPY !
customer_reviews.text: I bought this Movo for livestreaming on Twitch and it's not good. I was doing IRL on my phone connected on the jack and I was driving around my car and was making slot of static noise. So I did another test on my house walking around livestreaming it did the same. So I did another test without streaming just recording on the phone. And I STILL HEAR THE STATIC NOISE!!!. NOT RECOMMENDED FOR LIVESTREAMING! Dont waste your money on this. It's to expensive and it's not good. It does look well made but just won't do the job. I been a amazon customer for years I hope you take my word and be safe.
customer_reviews.author: George

customer_reviews.title: Amazing starter Mic !
customer_reviews.text: Major difference between having the mic plugged in and using a cameras built in microphone. Obviously this isn’t the best mic out there but for the price and what it comes with is more than a good deal. This is a great microphone for people who are starting off filmmaking or vlogging or whatever it may be. Couldn’t be more satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Gabriel C.

customer_reviews.title: Very good outdoor mic
customer_reviews.text: This is a solid mic for capturing directional sound outdoors. Just point the mic at your subject and you’re good to go. Sounds from behind the camera aren’t captured and the subject is captured clearly and cleanly. I haven’t tested the range yet, but I’ve captured sounds from at least 50 feet away with ease. Oh one warning. Do NOT use this mic indoors unless you have a special sound room setup. If you do have such a setup, stop looking at cheap mics. Anyway, the mic will captured and accentuate echos and your sound will be unusable.
customer_reviews.author: Al G

customer_reviews.title: This little thing is magic!!
customer_reviews.text: So far (I've only gotten to use it once) this little mic has made a huge difference. Since the pandemic, I've had to get scrappy and figure out other ways to make money. One of them is to create a YouTube channel with my hair tips and tricks... hopefully to help people AND generate interest in my online store. The first several videos were done with just my ipad....then I purchased this mic and had my neighbor use her camera with it. WOW.. a huge difference!!!! I'm so very impressed!! I'm hoping it lasts!!!
customer_reviews.author: KP

customer_reviews.title: Great Value, Very Nice Sound
customer_reviews.text: Sound quality is crisp and bright - significant improvement over my Galaxy S20 internal microphone. Used an AuxLink Hi-Fi Pro 384KHz/32Bit adapter cable to connect it to the phone's USB-C port. The shock mount was about what you would expect for this price. Phone sensed the MOVO mic and automagically used it as input. The windscreen worked very well - cut out the wind noise and did not appreciably muffle my voice when using it outdoors on a windy day. Nice that it came with both TRS and TRRS cables. Saved me buying a TRRS cable
customer_reviews.author: Paul A

customer_reviews.title: I like it
customer_reviews.text: So far, so good. The mic cancels out echos and the deadcat canceled out the wind noise (I tested it outside). I’ll be recording at the beach for a work video so I’ll update this review when I use the mic in windier conditions. Since some of the reviews mentioned that the clip broke easily for them, I was careful when placing it on the mic. It worked out and it didn’t break. I’ll find out with more use if I’ll have to replace at all. (The picture shows the mic on a phone mount and the deadcat is next to it.)
customer_reviews.author: Roses_19

customer_reviews.title: The Reviews are correct on the Breaking of the mount
customer_reviews.text: Hi, I bought this on accident because I needed to replace my Rode that I lost. I wasn't paying attention and they look the same. When it came, I realized I ordered the wrong thing. I decided to send it back...and then...decided I would instead keep it and give it a try. I used it one time and the plastic mic holder, as denoted in the other reviews, broke. I am now for certain sending it back. My Rode took a beating and never broke or snapped. This was used one time and is now useless.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Anthony

customer_reviews.title: Amazing sound wish it had a clip..
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic product the self is absolutely wonderful, however it doesn't come with the clip for this to attach to the phone itself.. a selfie stick is sold separately. The clip is the same as a camera light. this microphone can be easily attached to any professional camera however with cell phones I suggest everyone to buy the set they have same Mic but comes with selfie stick and the clip.. and please read carefully this version does not come with an iPhone adapter. And they also have a package with the iPhone adapter.. so please read carefully..
customer_reviews.author: Karaoke Jocky/ DJ

customer_reviews.title: Works great with iOS 12 on an iPhone 6
customer_reviews.text: This worked out of the box on my iPhone 6 (iOS 12), taking videos with the stock Camera app. Sounds quality was very satisfactory (for a non-pro), and the price is really good. While holding the microphone in my hand, I recorded my daughter's singing group (performing in a large, open building). It sounded *far* better than the tiny built-in microphone on either the iPhone or a recent Lumix point-and-shoot camera. I trimmed the recordings in Audacity, and played the resulting MP3s in my car stereo with great satisfaction!
customer_reviews.author: Wm. Enestvedt

customer_reviews.title: Nice small affordable mic
customer_reviews.text: The best thing about this mic that it's really light and small. The sound quality is ok, Rode does a better job, but for the price I think it's a good option for upgrading the audio of a camera or phone. I'm a proffesional audio-engineer who also films and makes video productions, the audio is good enough for simple video purposes. Can handle some wind, but does not perform well in hard winds, the audio gets disrupted by the wind. A zeppelin with boom is still the best option in hard winds.
customer_reviews.author: Ralph Durgaram

customer_reviews.title: Sounding off on an off sound
customer_reviews.text: Used this microphone three times during the past eleven months. Each time I was careful with it. The ring is already separating from the wind shield. More importantly, the microphone makes no noticeable difference in sound quality from the built in cell phone mics. I tried a few different phones. I used the cord designated for cell phone usage. Also, the pieces inside the mic now rattle when moved. I regret not discovering this sooner because it is past the return date now.
customer_reviews.author: RedTapeRebel

customer_reviews.title: Great value, great sound!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve seen a few reviews about this and it’s obvious competitor, and I thought I’d take a chance. It is a great value. It has amazing sound for what it is, very well built. It comes with two of the mic mounts, a dead cat w/ foam interior, two cables, and a bag. Others complained about the mounts, but as long as you put it on per the instructions and carefully remove it, it is perfectly adequate. I ordered spares just to have around in case I break these two. Very pleased with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Staron

customer_reviews.title: Loved it!
customer_reviews.text: This is a GREAT little microphone. Perfect for YouTubers, IGTVers and all the other "ers" ! It came with an informative little pamphlet with a QR code that led to all the tutorials on how to set it up. My only complaint - and its not against this product, but against Apple - is that I had to use an adapter to plug it in to my iPhone. Because Apple is dumb and they got rid of the audio jack. #firstworldproblems Other than that - works great, easy to use and gives me GREAT sound quality!
customer_reviews.author: Alicia Flores

customer_reviews.title: Requires phantom power, does not work with my canon camcorder
customer_reviews.text: I was pretty excited about this mic, because it had so many good reviews. Unfortunately, it is not universal and doesnt work with my Canon Vixia HF R800. After digging through some forums, i figured out that it wasnt working because the Vixia doesnt provide phantom power...which this mic requires. Separately, i tested this mic on my Canon M50 mirrorless camera....the audio quality was not noticably different from the built-in mic. In summary...it doesn't work without phantom power, which many devices do not provide. When it does work, the audio quality is nothing special.
customer_reviews.author: Lightningfrog27

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price, but extra steps with iPhone.
customer_reviews.text: This works extremely well for the price if you know how to use it. It works great with my Canon Rebel T3i as well as my iPhone 8. The sound is clear and does not pick up a lot of external noises. If you plan to use this with an iPhone there’s 3 steps. Plug the cord into the camera and the phone end into the dongle. Open the camera app. Then plug the dongle in. If you don’t do this the phone will treat the mic like headphones and it’ll only record with the iPhone mic.
customer_reviews.author: zac colley

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good, all things considered.
customer_reviews.text: Pretty good, all things considered. For the price point, this is a solid mic. It comes pretty close the the Rode Video Micro for roughly $20 bucks less. Yes, the shock mount is somewhat fragile, but so are many of the others, including the Rode. If you keep mounting and unmounting, eventually breaking is inevitable. Sound quality overall, is a bit louder than the Rode and slightly tinny, but with minimal adjustment in post, it sounds pretty good. This is a solid compact and budget-friendly mic for a beginner. This is also a solid backup to any of the other portable mics out there. Definitely worth the pick up and placement in your gear setup!
customer_reviews.author: Josho4

customer_reviews.title: Great mic for beginners, plug and play!
customer_reviews.text: Great little mic for your phone, if that's what you are using it for. You can really tell the difference in the sound quality from your phone vs using the mic. I have really enjoyed it. I've been using it to capture audio and video recordings. Make sure you do a little research into the difference between trrs and trs cords. The mic uses the trs end and a phone would need the trrs end of the cord (3.5mm Jack). The kit does come with both variations, but if you have to use an adapter, make sure the adapter is trrs compatible.
customer_reviews.author: Helpful Consumer

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t get the results I wanted
customer_reviews.text: The quality of this product is great but the outcome is not fantastic. It is very easy to use in that u literally just plug it in. However.... 1. It doesn’t make it easy for people with a non-professional set up. There’s nothing included for you to just clip this on to you tripod. 2. I used this for self-tapes for acting and I don’t feel it really made a difference in sound. I returned this product.
customer_reviews.author: Dawn Abbey

customer_reviews.title: Does not live up to the hype
customer_reviews.text: After reading rave reviews on here and on Youtube, I bought this mic expecting something wonderful. Kind of disappointed - mic has high self noise, isn't that directional, and has kind of a hokey suspension system that does not protect it at well from movement. I returned it the same day I got it after testing it out. Maybe good if you are not that much into audio and need something better than the built-in mic on your camera.
customer_reviews.author: P. S. Prakash

customer_reviews.title: Great signal boost for DSLR
customer_reviews.text: A gem of a small mic that offers a good signal boost (without a preamp) over built-in camera mics and without needing a battery. The recorded sound is clear, present, and focused with a minimum of ambient sound from the 3 - 6 ft.distances from which I have recorded. Although the frequency response is 35Hz-18Khz, I haven't experienced any noticeable or distracting limitations in the recording quality. A great little workhorse for a fantastic price.
customer_reviews.author: Fran Murphy

customer_reviews.title: Best budget mini shotgun microphone PERIOD
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely the BEST budget mini shotgun microphone out there. In a side by side test against the RODE video micro this is by far a better and more robust sounding microphone. Great to use as a GoPro 5/6/7 vlogging setup microphone and also works with the DJI Osmo Action. It's so good, I had to buy 2 additional ones. For the price you can NOT go wrong and adding the dead cat makes it perfect in windy conditions.
customer_reviews.author: Worth it or Not

customer_reviews.title: A GOOD BUY
customer_reviews.text: I haven't really found anything to complain about with this product. I bought it to attach to my Sony 4K Action Camera, and it does that. I suspect the noise cancellation could be better in windy conditions, but I haven't experienced anything that was annoying yet. The size is excellent for mounting on the camera post, and the material quality is better than the price would suggest. For the hobby'ist, occasional action camera use, this works just fine. I'd buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Circle B Ranch

customer_reviews.title: Misleading Package Promotion.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the Movo as part of a package with a DJI Osmo 3 gimbal. My expectation was that the Movo would attach to the Osmo and my iPhone. This was not the case and I had to return the Movo for a refund. I can't comment on the quality of the Movo since I wasn't able to use it. I will say that I was disappointed though I'm not sure who with; did Amazon "package" them or some other entity? Either way, in this instance I didn't get what I was expecting. But I'm still a dedicated Amazon shopper.
customer_reviews.author: johnebert

customer_reviews.title: Nikon D500, check... Windows 10 PC, check... I’m happy
customer_reviews.text: Great little mic for working at home! Also, it works with my Nikon D500! So, one mic instead of a dedicated computer mic and camera mount mic... very impressed with this little thing for the price! I have it mounted to a magic arm and it sits just above my keyboard. Coworkers say my audio is much better since using this over the built in mic or even just through my web cam!
customer_reviews.author: Logan H.Top Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Using the microphone with the iPhone was better than not using the microphone.
customer_reviews.text: We've been live streaming our church services using an iPhone with its microphone. The sound has been muffled. Of course the mic was about 12 feet from the pastor. We hooked up the MOVO microphone without the "dead cat" wind muffler and the sound was better. Not tremendously better but, better. I was disappointed that the mechanical hookup for the microphone was one that attached to a tripod. I'm sure that there are tripods that hold both the iPhone and have a tripod connector but we didn't have that so had to bring a second tripod to use this microphone.
customer_reviews.author: Very S

customer_reviews.title: High quality mic, with low noise
customer_reviews.text: I can confirm, like I've heard other reviews and test say, that this mic is low noise, with a flat frequency response. It has an even more flat frequency response (especially a better low frequency response) than mics that cost much more than it. This is a great option if you're looking for a high quality phone/iPad/camera mic that doesn't need batteries or external power, this is a great option at a very low cost!
customer_reviews.author: Jacob

customer_reviews.title: If you need a mic this is it!
customer_reviews.text: This mic is amazing it can absolutely go head to head with the Rode Micro. Check YouTube reviews and then save yourself $20 on just the mic not to mention all the accessories. I like the sound it picks up the lower tones better than the Rode. I’ve heard complaints about the shock absorber/mic holder I’ve had no problems with it at all. I’ve had it about a month now.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome mic and quality in an affordable price
customer_reviews.text: I love this little mic. Granted, I am not an expert or even remotely close to one but as a consumer I can say this mic is outstanding. GREAT sound quality and heavy duty feel to it. I have some very very small almost nitpicky issues. Mostly just the issue of having it stand up on its own which it's not really designed or intended to do but I think it would be cool to have an option available to have like a little stand or something. Again, this is a nitpicky complaint and in no way affects my overall opinion which is that this mic is totally worth the price and perhaps more.
customer_reviews.author: Zach Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Small, compact and with good sound.
customer_reviews.text: Overall a very decent quality mini shotgun mic. The only thing I'm concerned about is the mic clip/mount. I keep holding my breath when placing the mic into the clip...seems more like a hard plastic than a rubbery mount. So far so good...hasn't broken yet. Sound quality is pretty good...better than expected. I'm very pleased with this budget friendly little mic.
customer_reviews.author: The Yoginator

customer_reviews.title: DOES NOT WORK ON PHONES
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this product for almost a month and it does NOT work on with my iPhone. I have tried and tested the microphone several times but you can not hear any sound from it. I would not recommend buying this. I haven't tested it on cameras but I can guarantee that it will not work on your phones. Sadly I didn't get to use it for a couple of weeks due to being out of town for a family emergency so I can't return it because the 30 days is up. Don't make the same mistake. Do not buy this product...
customer_reviews.author: An amazed reader

customer_reviews.title: Nice sound, GREAT customer service, bad shock piece
customer_reviews.text: Update: The seller immediately sent me a replacement shock piece. Totally happy with this purchase. See my earlier post below. I had trouble getting the mic to work, so I called Movo Photo and talked to an absolutely great and knowledgeable customer service guy. Turned out it was likely my camera case. Silly, but he didn't make me feel stupid. The other issue is that the shock piece broke when I pushed it onto the mic. This guy is sending me a new piece, which I totally appreciate.
customer_reviews.author: Marilyn Bay Drake

customer_reviews.title: Works on iPhone X!
customer_reviews.text: So this is the thing... everyone in youtube says that with this mic you need a TRS to TRRS adapter to put this mic onto your iphone directly, but in the box it is included a cable TRS to put on the mic and TRRS in the other side to put onto your hack 3.5mm to lighting adapter, and in works perfectly instantanely. Beatiful sounds!
customer_reviews.author: Samuel Giubi

customer_reviews.title: Great deal in a small package!
customer_reviews.text: Picks up the audio well although I had hoped for a little more noise cancelling. However, for the price one cannot expect better... definitely improved the quality of my recordings on a dslr camera and removed the mechanical and operational noises when zooming. Small, compact and lightweight. Happy with the audio cables provided. The "dead kitten" sound dampener works well in windy situations. The clip seems a bit flimsy but havent broken it yet so am cool with it... the flimsiness actually seems intentional in order to provide flexibility and further improve noise cancellation... competed well with the Rode Mini and at a better price point so am very happy.
customer_reviews.author: Satisfied Customer

customer_reviews.title: Major upgrade from built in phone mic
customer_reviews.text: We use it for a Android phone to do a live broadcast and it sounds so much better louder and less backround noise. Sure there is better pro mics but great value here. I broke the red mount but I was likely at fault I still like it.
customer_reviews.author: robert mcconnell

customer_reviews.title: SOUND RECORD QUALITY IS GREAT, WINDSCREEN NOT SO MUCH
customer_reviews.text: The recorded sound quality of this mic is great given the price. Attached to my cheap camcorder I purchased off of Amazon without issue. The deadcat windscreen; however, is not so great. The material comes off literally like a shedding cat. I don't know how long the windscreen will last before I start seeing sporadic bald spots.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher B.

customer_reviews.title: Best little Mic for under $100
customer_reviews.text: Love this mic for getting better audio on my Canon EOS R mirrorless camera and my Sony A7sii. Way better wind reduction than the internal mics and pulls in a nice fat audio waveform at 6’ - even at 10’ it’s still much better than the internal mics. Comes with both iPhone cord and DSLR cord. For the money it’s a great buy. If you’d like to see our full review on the Movo Mic check out our YouTube Channel: Film Jams.
customer_reviews.author: Jules Fitzegibbons

customer_reviews.title: Great quality!
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice little microphone! I use this on a boom stand for "talking head" type shots with an extension cable to my Sony A7III. The quality is quite nice, but a little heavy on the low end. It's easy enough to tweak the sound in post. The best part of this microphone is the high output. I barely need to turn up the gain on my camera since the mic runs so hot.
customer_reviews.author: Dave D.

customer_reviews.title: Really Great!
customer_reviews.text: When talking to the camera (iPhone, DSLR, etc.) this mic really does the trick. The sound is fuller and richer than the built-in mic. When you start to get further away, so does the benefits. Over 8feet away I would suggest a lapel mic. I show in the video that there's a good difference at distance, but within 3-5 feet, this mic can't be beat (for the price range!).
customer_reviews.author: Bryan C.

customer_reviews.title: Great Microphone Poor Shock Mount
customer_reviews.text: I would have given this 5 stars except the shock mount is of poor design. I have to purchase my 3rd one. Th first one broke because of me. The second broke broke fater attached. The plastic is weak. So I purchased a 3rd one and what will be my last one. I did leave a review on the MOVO site. I gave the shock mount a 1 star review but MOVO didn't like it so they deleted it leaving only 5 star reviews.
customer_reviews.author: Ss1494

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: Small compact mic with pretty good sound. Note: When using in the beginning, know that if you leave the mic plugged into your phone during play-back, you will not hear the sound. Unplug to hear the quality of your sound. Facepalm!
customer_reviews.author: kaguinn

customer_reviews.title: Decent
customer_reviews.text: Pros: really well built and it has sustained several drops of of my table(more on that later), It Comes with several cables to meet you needs, and it is plug and play. Cons: sound quality is alright but it gets bad when things are too close or too loud, it doesn’t come with a tripod of any kind and it constantly falls over in its little included stand (I realize that’s not what its meant for), and it cost me $40 dollars Overall, I think it is alright but there are probably better options out there
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: One of the best mics I have
customer_reviews.text: These microphone is a pro level great mic at a incredible value. I have two of them and use them on my cameras all the time. I also use them on booms and often use them for podcasting giving me a rich sound. They provide a loud level into my camera preamps and sound great when using my digital recorders such as Zoom H1. I highly recommend this small versatile mic for all your production needs.
customer_reviews.author: KB

customer_reviews.title: Good sound quality, easy operation, cannot solve clicking sound issue when recording audio
customer_reviews.text: I cannot give this microphone a full review without addressing an intermittent clicking sound that occurs while recording, about every five seconds. I’m using it with an iPhone 7 and the dongle adapter. I’ve tried switching out cables, turning off WiFi/Bluetooth/cell signal, tried hooking it up to a different device to record. Still, on playback, the audio has a distinct click that occurs every few seconds. If anyone has any insight on the problem please help and i will gladly update this review.
customer_reviews.author: AN

customer_reviews.title: Great Sound for the Price
customer_reviews.text: Impressed with the simple sound quality of this mic. Super portable, good sound quality at an excellent price. The dead cat actually did pretty well against 15-30 mph strong wind, but you just can't get it all. Your subjects should be no further than 10 feet away to really capture the sound, but not bad for a quick interview, selfie mode or something you want to record directly in front of you.
customer_reviews.author: justanothercustomer

customer_reviews.title: Its definitely worth the price
customer_reviews.text: I dont have a big knowledge of seperate microphones, but id like to say i know more than an average person. The sound playback with this mic is very nice. My buddy who messes with microphones and hd videos says its similar to another $70 microphone, and its only 40. I dont have too much to compare to, but I can say its ALOT better than a phone or gorpo mic. Seems pretty durable to. If you are on a tight budget and need a good modular microphone for your phone and camcorder, than I really dont see how you can go wrong with this one. Its really nice so far.
customer_reviews.author: kyle

customer_reviews.title: Did work with Galaxy Note8 but with a note
customer_reviews.text: The 3.5mm TRRS mic cable connector deactivates the cell phone's internal mic AND speaker since it thinks you are using an ear bud with both a mic and in-ear speakers. When you use the VXR10, being a mic only device, it DOES record audio but to playback audio you must unplug the 3.5mm TRRS connector from the phone to allow it to use the phone's built-in speakers.
customer_reviews.author: B. Loyola

customer_reviews.title: Great for live-streaming volleyball matches
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for live-streaming volleyball matches in echo prone gyms. Before using this, I had friends and family complain they could not hear me. Now the audio is so good that my otherwise before unheard cursing was picked up; I guess I’ll need to take a few steps away from now on before I curse under my breath on an unforced error or tanked service play.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph P. Hupy

customer_reviews.title: Great little mic
customer_reviews.text: At first I didn't see much of a difference when playing around with it. But once I started editing my vlogs, I can see a big difference in audio quality when I'm using the mic vs when I'm not. I currently have it set up on my iPhone. And it works great. Do keep in mind that you must be facing the mic (the sound must be coming from the same direction as the mic). That can get annoying, but that's standard.
customer_reviews.author: Tash

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product for the price
customer_reviews.text: I had been recording videos for a YouTube channel using only my cell phone (Google Pixel 3). The video quality is excellent, but the audio quality is extremely poor. My hope was that this microphone would fix that, and it has done so in spades. The microphone was easy to assemble, fits and screws snugly into the cold shoe mount, and produces excellent quality audio for my videos. I'm sure there are much more expensive microphones out there that would produce even better audio, but for the price range this one is excellent.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff White

customer_reviews.title: Best for the money
customer_reviews.text: I also bought the Rhode Video Micro and the build quality is exactly the same aside from the rubber vibration dampening mount and cable that comes with the Rhode. It definitely is an improvement over a built in phone or camera microphone for sure and is a great size for vlogging (I don't vlog though). But if you're gonna need something better than either of these two mics, just look for a dedicated recorder and boom microphone. Also, the wind screen is really good at filtering out wind noise, but it's super huge. Would be nice to have something that doesn't defeat the purpose of the mic's low profile design.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy M.

customer_reviews.title: Does what I bought it for perfectly
customer_reviews.text: I'm not really interested in using this mic for vlogging a lot (if at all) or anything like that. The main reason I purchased it was to capture song ideas on my phone, and it does the job perfectly. During play back I can hear both my guitar and vocals with perfect volume and excellent clarity. It 100% fits the bill for exactly the reason I ordered it. 5 stars all the way!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: did not even work :(
customer_reviews.text: First, I was really excited about this microphone for my camera because I heard it was better than the Rode VideoMicro and cheaper! The mount fit perfectly on my canon m50 camera but the audio just didn't work. I tried fixing it in my settings but there was still never any audio whenever it was plugged into my camera. I guess I just got a defect one but I still wish I had a working microphone because I spent money on it :(
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic customer service!
customer_reviews.text: The microphone itself is perfect, but the plastic mount is quite fragile. I broke mine with pretty minimal effort the first time I tried to remove it (apparently you should always make sure to press from directly behind and in front of the horseshoe-shaped clip when removing and attaching the mount to the microphone). That said, their customer service was amazingly responsive and immediately shipped out a new mount and I received it within two days. That's what I call fantastic customer service. Rest assured they stand behind their products; order with confidence!
customer_reviews.author: Eric M. Miller

customer_reviews.title: Great Product, Great Price
customer_reviews.text: There is a clear difference between my phone's microphone and using this microphone. Much less background noise, and even when using the mic to record multiple instruments, each comes through. I am very pleased with this, especially for the price. Please note if you get this for a newer iPhone you need your lightening adapter, it does not come with one.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Starinieri

customer_reviews.title: Very good!
customer_reviews.text: The Movo has received a lot of praise for its similarity to the more expensive RODE Video Micro, and for good reason. While the Micro I think has slightly better sound, the Movo has a stronger signal (good for cameras with poor pre amps) and comparable enough sound and build quality to make it a good purchase. Very good value for money.
customer_reviews.author: A.L.

customer_reviews.title: Great compact mic
customer_reviews.text: We got this to do some YouTube video work with our GoPro 5 and Panasonic cameras and so far are quite pleased with the quality. Sounds every bit as good as the comparable Rode. Included wind muff has worked well. Definitely recommend it if you're looking for a nice, compact shotgun mic that is powered by your camera battery.
customer_reviews.author: Thespian

customer_reviews.title: Value and sound quality for your money
customer_reviews.text: I've used cheap microphones in the past so I was a little skeptical, however I've been surprised with the results of the Movo, I've been blogging with strong wind conditions, in noisy streets for my youtube channel and it definitely holds up, this is perfect for a small mirrorless camera like an M50 or a a6400, and you'll get improved audio quality.
customer_reviews.author: Oscar Abarca

customer_reviews.title: This is a 5-Star Product
customer_reviews.text: Great microphone! Using this as a second mic on my rig. Together with a lavaliere this makes for an amazing setup. I tried using the Saramonic audio mixer bit couldn't get both channels to work - so I bought a splitter cable and it worked perfectly, don't even need the audio mixer because really any of sound issues are resolved in post. Great product, solid build and does exactly what it says it does.
customer_reviews.author: Sage Law of Literally Magic™

customer_reviews.title: Nit satisfied at all.
customer_reviews.text: When I plug in the microphone into my iPhone, it makes a clicking noise and it effects the video on YouTube. Very bad.. it maybe a good price but if you have to buy another one later on for better qualities then do not waste your time and money. I’ll tell my friends and family if they are buying this.
customer_reviews.author: Momo

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good for filmmaking and vlogging.
customer_reviews.text: Not a bad piece of equipment. I test recorded a few video clips and the audio turned out pretty good. It didn't work with my camcorder when I used the other cord, but it still functions just fine when applied to my Samsung Galaxy A20. I'd say if you're gonna make a short film or vlog, use this mic for recording the audio. The wind cover doesn't cost quality either.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Furman

customer_reviews.title: This mic is great for Twitch Streaming!!
customer_reviews.text: I used to use a mixer for xlr mic audio to my stream, but it was always so complicated to adjust the levels perfectly (to avoid humming sounds). XLR is still the best to use, but I just got so tired of messing around with the 50 different dials on my mixer, so I got this mic instead. I bought a gooseneck 19 inch metal extension and a 5/8's desk clamp and this thing is plug and play it works like a freaking charm. It was a bit quiet in certain situations but just throw some gain on it, 3-5 db and it works like a charm. Audio is super clear. Enjoy!
customer_reviews.author: TallTechGuy

customer_reviews.title: Great competition for Rode!
customer_reviews.text: This is an awesome little microphone, and has become a staple tool for my YouTube channel (#Tristan and Rhett). It is pretty much the same as Rode microphones, but you save alot of money in the process. It is very easy to mount onto any hot shoe and is made of plastic and metal for a balance of durability and weight. Overall very pleased!
customer_reviews.author: Tristan

customer_reviews.title: Great for weddings
customer_reviews.text: This microphone was perfect for a recent wedding I attended. Picked up the pastor, bride and groom’s voices from 20 feet away much better than the iphone alone would have done. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: KLR59

customer_reviews.title: Does not work on my iPhone 11
customer_reviews.text: Does not work with my iPhone 11 even though I had the adaptor. Beware if you have an iPhone. I looked at reviews after mine wouldn’t work and it seems lots of folks have trouble with it working on iPhones. They should not state it is compatible with iPhones on product description if it is not.
customer_reviews.author: Theresa

customer_reviews.title: No mount for mobile phone!
customer_reviews.text: I thought this had the mount to connect to the mobile phone, it doesn’t. You’ll have to hold both the mic and cell phone in different hands. This won’t work for me and I doubt it’ll work for you if you’re using a DSLR Then it’ll be ok because it has the hot shoe mount. I’m disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: harry mapp

customer_reviews.title: Did not work, noticed no difference
customer_reviews.text: Shipping was fast. Packaging was well. Our microphone did not work. We did not notice any difference with our cellphone recording with mic and without it. Was hoping to find something that would work for outside recording. But also tested this inside, same, no difference.
customer_reviews.author: Olena B

customer_reviews.title: Sounds Great
customer_reviews.text: Just received today 02/14. Did a quick on camera audio test and it sounds just great. Will follow up with further info as we put it to work.
customer_reviews.author: Tommy Hughes

customer_reviews.title: Great product for its intended use
customer_reviews.text: Overall, very happy with the product. Purchased the MOVO VXR10 in June 2020 to use with a smartphone for a few virtual gatherings in the age of COVID-19. It performed admirably. People on the other side of the video call (zoom, facebook live, conference calls etc.) were impressed at the sound quality and background noise reduction. In this age of social distancing and limited travel, we found it a great supplement. Have not had a chance to try it with a DSLR in video mode to see how it performs and will update if there is any noticeable difference.
customer_reviews.author: M Millar

customer_reviews.title: Look elsewhere! Bad quality
customer_reviews.text: Not very good , lots of static and crackling , ordered the usb c to mic cable, that is the same result, tried the other cable no audio at all from mic , tried cables from my wireless mic same , popping and noise, other mic with these cables fine , I’ve tested it definitely a bad quality mic !
customer_reviews.author: Kc3kpe

customer_reviews.title: Very fragile holder
customer_reviews.text: This is a very fragile microphone holder. Mine broke soon after receiving. You will need to pack this carefully and never ever drop it. The sound quality is only marginally better. If the mic holder wasn’t essential this would be worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Derek
